Question put and agreed to.
The Dáil adjourned at 10.45 p.m.

MainHeading.Title: WRITTEN ANSWERS. - BALLYHAUNIS LOOTING CLAIM.

Speaker.hpid: TOMAS O CONAILL TOMAS O CONAILL
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Finance if he is now in a position to state whether the Judge's report in connection with the claim for compensation for looted property of Mr. P.A. Byrne, of Knox Street, Ballyhaunis, has yet been considered, and if he will state how soon settlement of this claim may be expected.
The enquiries which were necessary in connection with this case occupied longer than was anticipated. The offer of settlement will be made from my Department in the course of a few days.

MainHeading.RHead: R.I.C. MAN'S CLAIM TO A PENSION
MainHeading.Title: WRITTEN ANSWERS. - RESIGNED R.I.C. MAN'S CLAIM TO A PENSION.

Speaker.hpid: TOMAS O CONAILL TOMAS O CONAILL
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Finance if he will state what further action has been taken on the application for a pension of Thomas Baine, Belclare, Tuam, a resigned member of the R.I.C.
Mr. Baine's application for a pension was not recommended by the Committee of Inquiry, and I do not propose to authorise the grant of pension.

MainHeading.Title: WRITTEN ANSWERS. - CLAIM FOR COMPENSATION FOR ILL-TREATMENT.

Speaker.hpid: TOMAS O CONAILL TOMAS O CONAILL
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Finance whether an application has been received from Mr. P. Waldron, of Gurthaganny, Carabehey., Co. Roscommon, for compensation for ill-treatment and goods seized by enemy forces during the Anglo-Irish hostilities; whether such compensation has been refused, and, if so, what were the reasons for such refusal.

It has been ascertained by inquiry at the offices of the Compensation (Ireland) Commission that the claim referred to by the Deputy is at present under investigation and the points raised in the second part of the question do not, therefore, arise.

MainHeading.Title: WRITTEN ANSWERS. - BALLYHAUNIS LADY'S LOSSES.

Speaker.hpid: TOMAS O CONAILL TOMAS O CONAILL
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Finance whether an application has been received from Miss M.J. French, Clare Road, Ballyhaunis, for losses sustained during the enforcement of the British Military Order in 1921, prohibiting the holding of all fairs and markets in Ballyhaunis, and if he will state what action has been taken as a result of this application.

It has been ascertained from the Compensation (Ireland) Commission that the claim referred to by the Deputy is at present under investigation and that the decision of the Commission may be expected at an early date.

MainHeading.Title: WRITTEN ANSWERS. - RESIGNED R.I.C. MAN'S APPLICATION.

Speaker.hpid: TOMAS O CONAILL TOMAS O CONAILL
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Finance whether an application for a pension has been received from Thomas J. Quinn, of Ballygar, who served in the R.I.C. from October, 1917, to August, 1920, and resigned at Ballymore, County Westmeath, at the latter date for patriotic reasons, and if he will state whether the application has been favourably considered or not.
Mr. Quinn's application for a pension was investigated by the Committee of Inquiry which did not recommend the claim, and I do not see my way to authorise the grant of my pension in his case.

MainHeading.Title: WRITTEN ANSWERS. - DIVISION OF GORT ESTATE.

Speaker.hpid: TOMAS O CONAILL TOMAS O CONAILL
Speaker.P: asked the Minster for Lands and Agriculture whether an application has been received from the labourers formerly employed the Gough Estate, Loughcutra, Gort, for portions of the estate, and whether in view of the fact that these labourers lost their employment as a result of the acquiring of this estate by the Land Commission, their application will get prior consideration when the estate is being divided.
The notice given of this question was too short to enable me to obtain the necessary information to reply, and I would be glad if the Deputy would repeat the question at the next meeting of the Dáil.

MainHeading.Title: WRITTEN ANSWERS. - ACQUISITION OF ATHLONE ESTATE.

Speaker.hpid: SEAN O LAIDHIN SEAN O LAIDHIN
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Lands and Agriculture if the Land Commission have yet acquired the farm of Littleton, the property of Mr. Henry Napier Magill; further, whether an application was received by the Land Commission on behalf of the uneconomic holders in the district for the division of the Littleton farm, which is situated at the Pigeons, Glasson, Athlone, and if he can state when it is proposed to have this farm distributed for the relief of congestion.
The notice given of this question was too short to enable me to obtain the necessary information to reply, and I would be glad if the Deputy would repeat the question at the next meeting of the Dáil.

MainHeading.Title: WRITTEN ANSWERS. - CLAIM FOR UNEMPLOYMENT BENEFIT.

Speaker.hpid: SEAN O LAIDHIN SEAN O LAIDHIN
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Industry and Commerce if he can state why unemployment benefit has not been paid to Thomas Dalton, Packenham Road, Castlepollard, Westmeath, an ex-member of the National Army, who has been signing at the Labour Exchange, Mullingar, for eleven weeks, and whether inquiries will be made into the case with a view to payment of benefit.
I have been unable, in the time at my disposal, to make the necessary inquiries in this case. Investigation is, however, proceeding and I will communicate the result to the Deputy.

MainHeading.Title: WRITTEN ANSWERS. - ARREARS OF ARMY PAY.

Speaker.hpid: SEAN O LAIDHIN SEAN O LAIDHIN
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Defence if he will expedite payment of arrears of pay amounting to £16 and due from April to August, 1922, to John Caulderbanks, Army No. 07665, whose present address is 10 Healy Terrace, Longford.

There is no record of service given by John Caulderbanks of the address stated by the Deputy. His claim is, however, being investigated and I will communicate further with the Deputy relative to the matter.
